item.title: High School
item.description: Details Institution: Gymnasium bei St. Anna, Augsburg, Germany Duration: September 2008 - June 2016 (8 years) GPA: 2.5 (German high school scale) About my High School Education My high school’s education was focused on the humanities and offered a wide variety of classes. However, the focus was clearly on languages and social sciences but not limited to those. Most memorably, my school offered amazing extracurricular activities that taught me valuable lessons for life.
item.content:
Details

Institution: Gymnasium bei St. Anna, Augsburg, Germany

Duration: September 2008 - June 2016 (8 years)

GPA: 2.5 (German high school scale)

About my High School Education

My high school’s education was focused on the humanities and offered a wide variety of classes. However, the focus was clearly on languages and social sciences but not limited to those.

Most memorably, my school offered amazing extracurricular activities that taught me valuable lessons for life. In one of my classes, we crossed the alps with mountain bikes (8 days) which required rigorous planning, endurance and technique practice over the course of two years. It has taught me exceptional interpersonal and team working skills and the importance of collaboration.

The following list demonstrates the broad range of my high school education (numbers of years taught):

STEM

  • Mathematics (8)
  • Biology (7)
  • Physics (4)
  • Chemistry (3)
  • Exercise Science (2)
  • Computer Science (2)

Languages

  • German (8)
  • English (7)
  • Latin (6)
  • Italian (3)

Social Sciences

  • History (8)
  • Ethics & Religions (7)
  • Geography (6)
  • Sociology (2)
  • Economics & Law (2)

Other

  • Physical Education (8)
  • Arts (8)
  • Music (6)

item.title: Bachelor in Finance and Economics
item.description: Details Institution: University of Arkansas at Little Rock, USA Duration: August 2017 - May 2020 GPA: 3.88 Institutional Honors: Magna Cum Laude Academic Awards Pages Institution: Cardinal Stritch University, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, USA Duration: August 2016 - May 2017 (Freshman year) GPA: 3.92 Relevant Courses My degrees' most relevant and interesting courses that helped me shape my understanding of Financial and Economic principles and develop business acumen. Finance Financial Modeling
item.content:
Details

Institution: University of Arkansas at Little Rock, USA

Duration: August 2017 - May 2020

GPA: 3.88

Institutional Honors: Magna Cum Laude

Academic Awards Pages

Institution: Cardinal Stritch University, Milwaukee, Wisconsin, USA

Duration: August 2016 - May 2017 (Freshman year)

GPA: 3.92

Relevant Courses

My degrees' most relevant and interesting courses that helped me shape my understanding of Financial and Economic principles and develop business acumen.

Finance

Financial Modeling

Solved hands-on financial problems using advanced Excel functions to build practical models.

Investment Analysis

Alternative investment opportunities, analysis of the economy, its industries, and particular businesses to determine the most desirable use of funds in terms of the objectives of individual and institutional investment programs.

Financial Markets

Examination and analysis of financial markets, such as savings institutions, banks, insurance companies, mutual funds, pension funds, and others.

Accounting

Fundamentals of financial accounting, recording, summarizing, and reporting cycle. Principles of asset valuation and income measurement; accounting systems and internal controls. Reporting for external investors. Management accounting and decision making.

Economics

Econometrics

Data collection, model specification, regression analysis, violations of regression assumptions and corrections, indicator variables, linear restrictions tests, and limited dependent variable models. Used R software to assist a public policy institute in decision making and advocacy efforts.

Microeconomics

Price and production theory. Consumer demand, the supply function, market pricing, and various degrees of competition.

Macroeconomics

National income analysis and its implications for public policy; its historical development and present status, including recent business cycle development.

Management

Business strategy

Integration of business concepts and techniques and their application to the development of corporate strategy and strategic planning by senior corporate executives. Includes setting objectives, developing business purposes, determining opportunities and threats, and implementing decision and control systems across functional areas.

Risk Management

Introduction to the fundamentals of risk management. Scope and fundamentals of property and liability insurance; analysis of contracts, rating, underwriting, insurers, and loss adjustments and procedures.

Production Management

Topics are selected from project management, operations strategy, quality management, inventory management, capacity planning, theory of constraints, transportation/ assignment problems, and an introduction to supply chain management.

Mathematics

Business Statistics 1 and 2

Foundations such multiple regression and correlation, goodness of fit, chi square and tests of independence, decision analysis and expected values, analysis of variance, sampling techniques, forecasting, decomposing a time series, and nonparametric tests.

Applied Calculus

Differential and integral calculus of algebraic, exponential, and logarithmic functions with applications to economics, management sciences, engineering technology, and the life sciences

item.title: Bachelor in Business Analytics
item.description: Details Institution: University of Arkansas at Little Rock, USA Duration: August 2020 - May 2021 Academic Awards Pages Relevant Courses The following courses are the most interesting and relevant courses in my one-year postbaccalaureate program. Analytics Predictive Analytics Using statistical methods (Multiple Regression, ANOVA, Logistic Regression, Quantile Regression, ARIMA) and statistical tools (R and Python) to predict financial and economic outcomes. Marketing Research Using Python and R to predict and test marketing outcomes (A/B testing, Multiple Regression, Clustering, T-Testing).
item.content:
Details

Institution: University of Arkansas at Little Rock, USA

Duration: August 2020 - May 2021

Academic Awards Pages

Relevant Courses

The following courses are the most interesting and relevant courses in my one-year postbaccalaureate program.

Analytics

Predictive Analytics

Using statistical methods (Multiple Regression, ANOVA, Logistic Regression, Quantile Regression, ARIMA) and statistical tools (R and Python) to predict financial and economic outcomes.

Marketing Research

Using Python and R to predict and test marketing outcomes (A/B testing, Multiple Regression, Clustering, T-Testing).

Database Management Systems

Principles of database design, data manipulation, and data retrieval from commercial database systems (SQL Server, Oracle).

Data Analysis and Reporting

Advanced database techniques and data visualization, data warehousing, reporting, and other BI tools to solve business problems (Power BI, Tableau).

Big Data Analytics Tools

Extracting information from large databases and designing decision support systems. Summarizing, Predicting, and Explaining of observed phenomena such as patterns, trends, and consumer behavior (Power BI, SQL Server, Hadoop).

Information Systems Development Project

Developing a working information system, combining all methods and tools from the Business Analytics coursework.

Programming

Object-Oriented Programming

Introduction to object oriented programming using Java to build basic applications.

Advanced Programming

Using programming techniques to built practical business applications to automate processes.
